en: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1827 Oct. 22

This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This is from the Monday October 22, 1827 session of court, during which a trover case was heard. Details of court costs are contained herein. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

body.value: Monday 22nd October 1827 John Downing vs Martin Downing & mother Troven, try the right of a certain negroe womad negro woman Milay The Court find for the plaintiff The per Cent for the appeal - - - - $24.00 Witnesses James Crittenton attended 12 days 9.-- Alexander Saunders 3 days 2.25 Harry Downing 12 " 9.-- William Reid 14 do. ditto 10.50 â€• $54.75 Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock Execution issued 23rd October 1827 .
